author: KirkMunro
body:
# PR Summary

Add a line that clearly identifies renaming a parameter set as a non-breaking change.

## PR Context

https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/10058

## PR Checklist

- [X] [PR has a meaningful title](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
    - Use the present tense and imperative mood when describing your changes
- [X] [Summarized changes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
- [X] [Make sure all `.h`, `.cpp`, `.cs`, `.ps1` and `.psm1` files have the correct copyright header](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
- [X] This PR is ready to merge and is not [Work in Progress](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---work-in-progress).
    - If the PR is work in progress, please add the prefix `WIP:` or `[ WIP ]` to the beginning of the title (the `WIP` bot will keep its status check at `Pending` while the prefix is present) and remove the prefix when the PR is ready.
- **[Breaking changes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#making-breaking-changes)**
    - [X] None
    - **OR**
    - [ ] [Experimental feature(s) needed](https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/PowerShell-Docs/blob/staging/reference/6/Microsoft.PowerShell.Core/About/about_Experimental_Features.md)
        - [ ] Experimental feature name(s): <!-- Experimental feature name(s) here -->
- **User-facing changes**
    - [X] Not Applicable
    - **OR**
    - [ ] [Documentation needed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
        - [ ] Issue filed: <!-- Number/link of that issue here -->
- **Testing - New and feature**
    - [X] N/A or can only be tested interactively
    - **OR**
    - [ ] [Make sure you've added a new test if existing tests do not effectively test the code changed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#before-submitting)

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I think it is not right change - parameter sets is public. See #10099

comments.author: KirkMunro
comments.body:
Yet in https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/10058, @SteveL-MSFT says the following:

> @PowerShell/powershell-committee reviewed this. We reaffirm that **ParameterSet names are not a public api** and changing them is not a breaking change. We should update the breaking change contract doc to make this apparent and explicit.

Parameter set names are visible/accessible via cmdlet metadata and open source code, but they are not considered a public API that someone should take dependencies on.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Perhaps it is my misunderstanding public api in code and in documentation.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: We could add "System.Management.Automation.Internal" too. It was mentioned the other day.

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
I think the distinction that is being drawn (and I agree, does need to be drawn) is:

1. Parameter sets themselves (their "shape" and contents, so to speak) are a public API (they affect how a cmdlet can be used, therefore removing / significant changes to an existing set can be breaking), _but_
2. The internally-recorded **name** for any given parameter set isn't something people should be relying upon.

I hope that makes it a bit more clear?

With regards to S.M.A.Internal, I'd agree it should probably be explicitly mentioned as some of the types and members there are public and usable from PS itself, so the nature of the contract in that area should be clarified. Not sure if @SteveL-MSFT wants to make a separate decision on appropriate wording / additions there. 🙂

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: The discussion in @PowerShell/powershell-committee was specifically about renaming a parameterset which was reaffirmed as not considered a breaking change.  The parameter sets themselves are considered a public API and those changes would be breaking.  As for SMA.Internal namespace, it is by definition not a public API even though can be called without reflection.  We don't document those APIs and users should not depend on them not changing.  Seems like `internal` shouldn't need to be called out explicitly.

title: Identify renaming a parameter set as non-breaking in the breaking change contract document
